intro: Mappa cumingii, commonly known as the Cuming's mappa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen shrub form with dense, leathery leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in early spring. It thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and requires a cool, humid climate. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and valuable species in horticulture.
